notes.text: Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security (RHACS). The updated image includes security fixes.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of RHACS includes fixes for the following security vulnerabilities:

* npm-serialize-javascript: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in serialize-javascript (CVE-2024-11831)

* go-git: Argument injection via the URL field (CVE-2025-21613)

* go-git: Go-git clients vulnerable to DoS via maliciously crafted Git server replies (CVE-2025-21614)

* golang.org/x/crypto: Misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause authorization bypass in golang.org/x/crypto (CVE-2024-45337)

* golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html (CVE-2024-45338)
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in npm-serialize-javascript. The vulnerability occurs because the serialize-javascript module does not properly sanitize certain inputs, such as regex or other JavaScript object types, allowing an attacker to inject malicious code. This code could be executed when deserialized by a web browser, causing Cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. This issue is critical in environments where serialized data is sent to web clients, potentially compromising the security of the website or web application using this package.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: npm-serialize-javascript: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in serialize-javascript
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.6.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in the x/crypto/ssh go library. Applications and libraries that misuse the ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback callback may be susceptible to an authorization bypass. For example, an attacker may send public keys A and B and authenticate with A. PublicKeyCallback would be called only twice, first with A and then with B. A vulnerable application may then make authorization decisions based on key B, for which the attacker does not control the private key. The misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause an authorization bypass.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang.org/x/crypto/ssh: Misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause authorization bypass in golang.org/x/crypto
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This vulnerability is classified as important rather than critical because it does not directly enable unauthorized access but rather introduces a risk of authorization bypass if the application or library misuses the PublicKeyCallback API. The vulnerability relies on incorrect assumptions made by the application when handling the sequence or state of keys provided during SSH authentication. Properly implemented systems that use the Permissions field or avoid relying on external state remain unaffected. Additionally, the vulnerability does not allow direct exploitation to gain control over a system without the presence of insecure logic in the application's handling of authentication attempts.


Red Hat Enterprise Linux(RHEL) 8 and 9 marked as not affected as it was determined that the problem function `ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback`, as noted in the CVE-2024-45337 issue, is not called by Podman, Buildah, containers-common, or the gvisor-tap-vsock projects.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.6.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang.org/x/crypto/ssh: Misuse of ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback may cause authorization bypass in golang.org/x/crypto

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang.org/x/net/html. This flaw allows an attacker to craft input to the parse functions that would be processed non-linearly with respect to its length, resulting in extremely slow parsing. This issue can cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is rated as an Important severity because an attacker can craft malicious input that causes the parsing functions to process data non-linearly, resulting in significant delays which leads to a denial of service by exhausting system resources.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.6.

vulnerabilities.title: golang.org/x/net/html: Non-linear parsing of case-insensitive content in golang.org/x/net/html

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Argument Delimiters in a Command ('Argument Injection')

notes.text: An argument injection vulnerability was found in go-git. This flaw allows an attacker to set arbitrary values to git-upload-pack flags, leading to command or code execution, exposure of sensitive data, or other unintended behavior. This is only possible in configurations where the file transport protocol is being used.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: argument injection via the URL field
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.6.
In cases where it is not possible to update to the latest version of go-git, it is recommended to enforce validation rules for values passed in the URL field.

vulnerabilities.title: go-git: argument injection via the URL field

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in go-git. This vulnerability allows an attacker to perform denial of service attacks by providing specially crafted responses from a Git server, which triggers resource exhaustion in go-git clients.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: go-git clients vulnerable to DoS via maliciously crafted Git server replies
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.6.

vulnerabilities.title: go-git: go-git clients vulnerable to DoS via maliciously crafted Git server replies
